001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.squidgrid.Radius;
004
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006import java.util.Collections;
007import java.util.HashSet;
008
009/**
010 * This provides a Uniform Poisson Disk Sampling technique that can be used to generate random points that have a
011 * uniform minimum distance between each other. Due to Coord in SquidLib using ints and most Poisson Disk algorithms
012 * using floating-point numbers, some imprecision is to be expected from rounding to the nearest integers x and y.
013 *
014 * The algorithm is from the "Fast Poisson Disk Sampling in Arbitrary Dimensions" paper by Robert Bridson
015 * http://www.cs.ubc.ca/~rbridson/docs/bridson-siggraph07-poissondisk.pdf
016 *
017 * Adapted from C# by Renaud Bedard, which was adapted from Java source by Herman Tulleken
018 * http://theinstructionlimit.com/fast-uniform-poisson-disk-sampling-in-c
019 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 10/20/2015.
020 */
021public class PoissonDisk {
022    private static final float rootTwo = (float) Math.sqrt(2);
023    
024    private static final int defaultPointsPlaced = 10;
025    private static final Radius disk = Radius.CIRCLE;
026
027    private PoissonDisk() {
028    }
029
030    /**
031     * Get a list of Coords, each randomly positioned around the given center out to the given radius (measured with
032     * Euclidean distance, so a true circle), but with the given minimum distance from any other Coord in the list.
033     * The parameters maxX and maxY should typically correspond to the width and height of the map; no points will have
034     * positions with x equal to or greater than maxX and the same for y and maxY; similarly, no points will have
035     * negative x or y.
036     * @param center the center of the circle to spray Coords into
037     * @param radius the radius of the circle to spray Coords into
038     * @param minimumDistance the minimum distance between Coords, in Euclidean distance as a float.
039     * @param maxX one more than the highest x that can be assigned; typically an array length
040     * @param maxY one more than the highest y that can be assigned; typically an array length
041     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that satisfy the minimum distance; the length of the array can vary
042     */
043    public static OrderedSet<Coord> sampleCircle(Coord center, float radius, float minimumDistance,
044                                                int maxX, int maxY)
045    {
046        return sampleCircle(center, radius, minimumDistance, maxX, maxY, defaultPointsPlaced, new StatefulRNG());
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * Get a list of Coords, each randomly positioned around the given center out to the given radius (measured with
051     * Euclidean distance, so a true circle), but with the given minimum distance from any other Coord in the list.
052     * The parameters maxX and maxY should typically correspond to the width and height of the map; no points will have
053     * positions with x equal to or greater than maxX and the same for y and maxY; similarly, no points will have
054     * negative x or y.
055     * @param center the center of the circle to spray Coords into
056     * @param radius the radius of the circle to spray Coords into
057     * @param minimumDistance the minimum distance between Coords, in Euclidean distance as a float.
058     * @param maxX one more than the highest x that can be assigned; typically an array length
059     * @param maxY one more than the highest y that can be assigned; typically an array length
060     * @param pointsPerIteration with small radii, this can be around 5; with larger ones, 30 is reasonable
061     * @param rng an IRNG to use for all random sampling.
062     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that satisfy the minimum distance; the length of the array can vary
063     */
064    public static OrderedSet<Coord> sampleCircle(Coord center, float radius, float minimumDistance,
065                                                int maxX, int maxY, int pointsPerIteration, IRNG rng)
066    {
067        int radius2 = Math.round(radius);
068        return sample(center.translate(-radius2, -radius2), center.translate(radius2, radius2), radius, minimumDistance, maxX, maxY, pointsPerIteration, rng);
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Get a list of Coords, each randomly positioned within the rectangle between the given minPosition and
073     * maxPosition, but with the given minimum distance from any other Coord in the list.
074     * The parameters maxX and maxY should typically correspond to the width and height of the map; no points will have
075     * positions with x equal to or greater than maxX and the same for y and maxY; similarly, no points will have
076     * negative x or y.
077     * @param minPosition the Coord with the lowest x and lowest y to be used as a corner for the bounding box
078     * @param maxPosition the Coord with the highest x and highest y to be used as a corner for the bounding box
079     * @param minimumDistance the minimum distance between Coords, in Euclidean distance as a float.
080     * @param maxX one more than the highest x that can be assigned; typically an array length
081     * @param maxY one more than the highest y that can be assigned; typically an array length
082     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that satisfy the minimum distance; the length of the array can vary
083     */
084    public static OrderedSet<Coord> sampleRectangle(Coord minPosition, Coord maxPosition, float minimumDistance,
085                                                   int maxX, int maxY)
086    {
087        return sampleRectangle(minPosition, maxPosition, minimumDistance, maxX, maxY, defaultPointsPlaced, new StatefulRNG());
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Get a list of Coords, each randomly positioned within the rectangle between the given minPosition and
092     * maxPosition, but with the given minimum distance from any other Coord in the list.
093     * The parameters maxX and maxY should typically correspond to the width and height of the map; no points will have
094     * positions with x equal to or greater than maxX and the same for y and maxY; similarly, no points will have
095     * negative x or y.
096     * @param minPosition the Coord with the lowest x and lowest y to be used as a corner for the bounding box
097     * @param maxPosition the Coord with the highest x and highest y to be used as a corner for the bounding box
098     * @param minimumDistance the minimum distance between Coords, in Euclidean distance as a float.
099     * @param maxX one more than the highest x that can be assigned; typically an array length
100     * @param maxY one more than the highest y that can be assigned; typically an array length
101     * @param pointsPerIteration with small areas, this can be around 5; with larger ones, 30 is reasonable
102     * @param rng an IRNG to use for all random sampling.
103     * @return an ArrayList of Coord that satisfy the minimum distance; the length of the array can vary
104     */
105    public static OrderedSet<Coord> sampleRectangle(Coord minPosition, Coord maxPosition, float minimumDistance,
106                                                   int maxX, int maxY, int pointsPerIteration, IRNG rng)
107    {
108        return sample(minPosition, maxPosition, 0f, minimumDistance, maxX, maxY, pointsPerIteration, rng);
109    }
110
111    private static OrderedSet<Coord> sample(Coord minPosition, Coord maxPosition, float rejectionDistance,
112                                           float minimumDistance, int maxX, int maxY, int pointsPerIteration, IRNG rng)
113    {
114
115        Coord center = minPosition.average(maxPosition);
116        Coord dimensions = maxPosition.subtract(minPosition);
117        float cellSize = Math.max(minimumDistance / rootTwo, 0.25f);
118        int gridWidth = (int)(dimensions.x / cellSize) + 1;
119        int gridHeight = (int)(dimensions.y / cellSize) + 1;
120        Coord[][] grid = new Coord[gridWidth][gridHeight];
121        ArrayList<Coord> activePoints = new ArrayList<>();
122        OrderedSet<Coord> points = new OrderedSet<>(128);
123        rejectionDistance *= rejectionDistance;
124
125        //add first point
126        boolean added = false;
127        while (!added)
128        {
129            float d = rng.nextFloat();
130            int xr = Math.round(minPosition.x + dimensions.x * d);
131
132            d = rng.nextFloat();
133            int yr = Math.round(minPosition.y + dimensions.y * d);
134
135            if (rejectionDistance != 0f && center.distanceSq(xr, yr) > rejectionDistance)
136                continue;
137            added = true;
138            Coord p = Coord.get(Math.min(xr, maxX - 1), Math.min(yr, maxY - 1));
139            Coord index = p.subtract(minPosition).divide(cellSize);
140
141            grid[index.x][index.y] = p;
142
143            activePoints.add(p);
144            points.add(p);
145        }
146        //end add first point
147
148        while (activePoints.size() != 0)
149        {
150            int listIndex = rng.nextInt(activePoints.size());
151
152            Coord point = activePoints.get(listIndex);
153            boolean found = false;
154
155            for (int k = 0; k < pointsPerIteration; k++)
156            {
157                //add next point
158                //get random point around
159                float d = rng.nextFloat();
160                float radius = minimumDistance + minimumDistance * d;
161                float angle = rng.nextFloat();
162
163                float newX = radius * NumberTools.sin_(angle);
164                float newY = radius * NumberTools.cos_(angle);
165                Coord q = point.translateCapped(Math.round(newX), Math.round(newY), maxX, maxY);
166                //end get random point around
167
168                if (q.x >= minPosition.x && q.x <= maxPosition.x &&
169                        q.y >= minPosition.y && q.y <= maxPosition.y &&
170                        (rejectionDistance == 0f || center.distanceSq(q) <= rejectionDistance))
171                {
172                    Coord qIndex = q.subtract(minPosition).divide((int)Math.ceil(cellSize));
173                    boolean tooClose = false;
174
175                    for (int i = Math.max(0, qIndex.x - 2); i < Math.min(gridWidth, qIndex.x + 3) && !tooClose; i++) {
176                        for (int j = Math.max(0, qIndex.y - 2); j < Math.min(gridHeight, qIndex.y + 3); j++) {
177                            if (grid[i][j] != null && disk.radius(grid[i][j], q) < minimumDistance) {
178                                tooClose = true;
179                                break;
180                            }
181                        }
182                    }
183                    if (!tooClose)
184                    {
185                        found = true;
186                        activePoints.add(q);
187                        points.add(q);
188                        grid[qIndex.x][qIndex.y] = q;
189                    }
190                }
191                //end add next point
192            }
193
194            if (!found)
195            {
196                activePoints.remove(listIndex);
197            }
198        }
199        return points;
200    }
201
202    public static OrderedSet<Coord> sampleMap(char[][] map,
203                                              float minimumDistance, IRNG rng, Character... blocking)
204    {
205        return sampleMap(Coord.get(1, 1), Coord.get(map.length - 2, map[0].length - 2),
206                map, minimumDistance, rng, blocking);
207    }
208
209    public static OrderedSet<Coord> sampleMap(Coord minPosition, Coord maxPosition, char[][] map,
210                                             float minimumDistance, IRNG rng, Character... blocking) {
211        int width = map.length;
212        int height = map[0].length;
213        HashSet<Character> blocked = new HashSet<>();
214        Collections.addAll(blocked, blocking);
215        boolean restricted = (blocked.size() > 0);
216        Coord dimensions = maxPosition.subtract(minPosition);
217        float cellSize = Math.max(minimumDistance / rootTwo, 1f);
218        int gridWidth = (int) (dimensions.x / cellSize) + 1;
219        int gridHeight = (int) (dimensions.y / cellSize) + 1;
220        Coord[][] grid = new Coord[gridWidth][gridHeight];
221        ArrayList<Coord> activePoints = new ArrayList<>();
222        OrderedSet<Coord> points = new OrderedSet<>(128);
223
224        //add first point
225
226        Coord p = randomUnblockedTile(minPosition, maxPosition, map, rng, blocked);
227        if (p == null)
228            return points;
229        Coord index = p.subtract(minPosition).divide(cellSize);
230
231        grid[index.x][index.y] = p;
232
233        activePoints.add(p);
234        points.add(p);
235
236        //end add first point
237
238        while (activePoints.size() != 0) {
239            int listIndex = rng.nextInt(activePoints.size());
240
241            Coord point = activePoints.get(listIndex);
242            boolean found = false;
243
244            for (int k = 0; k < 20; k++) {
245                //add next point
246                //get random point around
247                float d = rng.nextFloat();
248                float radius = minimumDistance + minimumDistance * d;
249                d = rng.nextFloat();
250                float angle = d;
251
252                float newX = radius * NumberTools.sin_(angle);
253                float newY = radius * NumberTools.cos_(angle);
254                Coord q = point.translateCapped(Math.round(newX), Math.round(newY), width, height);
255                int frustration = 0;
256                while(restricted && blocked.contains(map[q.x][q.y]) && frustration < 8)
257                {
258                    d = rng.nextFloat();
259                    angle = d;
260                    newX = radius * NumberTools.sin_(angle);
261                    newY = radius * NumberTools.cos_(angle);
262                    q = point.translateCapped(Math.round(newX), Math.round(newY), width, height);
263                    frustration++;
264                }
265
266                //end get random point around
267
268                if (q.x >= minPosition.x && q.x <= maxPosition.x &&
269                        q.y >= minPosition.y && q.y <= maxPosition.y) {
270                    Coord qIndex = q.subtract(minPosition).divide((int) Math.ceil(cellSize));
271                    boolean tooClose = false;
272
273                    for (int i = Math.max(0, qIndex.x - 2); i < Math.min(gridWidth, qIndex.x + 3) && !tooClose; i++) {
274                        for (int j = Math.max(0, qIndex.y - 2); j < Math.min(gridHeight, qIndex.y + 3); j++) {
275                            if (grid[i][j] != null && disk.radius(grid[i][j], q) < minimumDistance) {
276                                tooClose = true;
277                                break;
278                            }
279                        }
280                    }
281                    if (!tooClose) {
282                        found = true;
283                        activePoints.add(q);
284                        if(!restricted || !blocked.contains(map[q.x][q.y]))
285                            points.add(q);
286                        grid[qIndex.x][qIndex.y] = q;
287                    }
288                }
289                //end add next point
290            }
291
292            if (!found)
293                activePoints.remove(listIndex);
294        }
295        return points;
296    }
297    /**
298     * Finds a random Coord where the x and y match up to a [x][y] location on map that has any value not in blocking.
299     * Uses the given IRNG for pseudo-random number generation.
300     * @param minPosition the Coord with the lowest x and lowest y to be used as a corner for the bounding box
301     * @param maxPosition the Coord with the highest x and highest y to be used as a corner for the bounding box
302     * @param map a dungeon map or something, x then y
303     * @param rng a IRNG to generate random choices
304     * @param blocked a Set of Characters that block a tile from being chosen
305     * @return a Coord that corresponds to a map element equal to tile, or null if tile cannot be found or if map is too small.
306     */
307    public static Coord randomUnblockedTile(Coord minPosition, Coord maxPosition, char[][] map, IRNG rng, HashSet<Character> blocked)
308    {
309        int width = map.length;
310        int height = map[0].length;
311        if(width < 3 || height < 3)
312            return null;
313        if(blocked.size() == 0) {
314            return Coord.get(rng.between(minPosition.x, maxPosition.x), rng.between(minPosition.y, maxPosition.y));
315        }
316
317        int x = rng.between(minPosition.x, maxPosition.x), y = rng.between(minPosition.y, maxPosition.y);
318        for(int i = 0; i < (width + height) / 4; i++)
319        {
320            if(!blocked.contains(map[x][y]))
321            {
322                return Coord.get(x, y);
323            }
324            else
325            {
326                x = rng.between(minPosition.x, maxPosition.x);
327                y = rng.between(minPosition.y, maxPosition.y);
328            }
329        }
330        x = 1;
331        y = 1;
332        if(!blocked.contains(map[x][y]))
333            return Coord.get(x, y);
334
335        while(blocked.contains(map[x][y]))
336        {
337            x += 1;
338            if(x >= width - 1)
339            {
340                x = 1;
341                y += 1;
342            }
343            if(y >= height - 1)
344                return null;
345        }
346        return Coord.get(x, y);
347    }
348
349}
